inn1.comm: immediately outswing for Bresnan. Length ball outside off, shaping in towards Parthiv, defended to leg
nice little gift for Patel, a gentle length ball down the pads, and he has glanced it fine for four
Patel whiplashes those cuts! Short and wide, and he has smashed it between cover and cover-point, he gave it some humpty
and now the wide down the leg side
this one seams away a touch, and beats Patel's defensive prod. The in-between length with not much room
and now he steers one to third man for a single
nice swing now, the perfect stuff for the right-hand batsman, pitches middle and off, swings away, Rahane defends from the crease
swings away from Patel, who chooses to watch it through to the keeper
drives at this length ball, and the away swing beats the edge... watching out for the outswinger Parthiv
another inswinger, pitched outside leg, moving towards middle and off, flicked to square leg
short on the pads, pulled away emphatically, along the ground, gets a couple to wide of long leg
good comeback, short of a length, pitches leg, nips away towards off. No room, and Patel can neither pull nor drive this
similar length, but slightly further outside off, steered away for a single

little dynamo, incredible shot.... he has walked at Bresnan and flicked him for a six! The flick-pull, what wrists. Just charges at Bresnan and gets under this shortish delivery, hits the skirting at the midwicket boundary
short of a length, angling in, cramps him up, defended to cover
Patel is having a ball here! Steers this short-of-a-length delivery through the vacant second slip region. Delightfully late to open the face here
good comeback from Bresnan, gets this to move against the angle, beats Patel's second attempt at a late-cut

Patel is reading as though the bowlers' intent is written on the big screen. Sits back deep, gets under this bouncer, which doesn't get up mind you, and pulls it up and over the area between deep square leg and deep midwicket
and he wants to keep the strike! Can't do it, though, as this late-cut can't beat point
and Rahane has handed over the strike to Patel. Just drops this short-of-a-length delivery towards point, and Patel charges up to the striker's end

Patel deliberates for a longish time if he should review this. I could lip-read him asking Rahane, "Aawaz aaya?" [Was there a noise?]. After much discussion he walks back. Here is what happened. This was short of a length, wide enough for Patel to try that whiplash cut again. The thin edge was taken, and England were spontaneous in their appeal. Given out. Rightly so. Whoa! HotSpot shows no edge! Snick shows one, though
short of a length, no room, he opens the face in an attempt for a single, finds point
steered wide of the lone slip this time for a single
shortish, angling into the pads, wanted to work it away with the angle, but couldn't place it past square leg
short of a length, not much room, pushed back to Anderson. What an over from Anderson to pull things back
sits back to try and run this to third man, can't beat point
cut away powerfully, but Bell makes a diving save to his right, fielding at point
he has adapted to the format really well... tries the orthodox cut twice without any results, and this time he cuts it over the infield. Deliberately under it to clear the infield
that upper-cut makes Broad pitch the ball up, and immediately, like the Tests, Broad becomes twice as dangerous. Lovely outswinger here beats Dravid's drive
another outswinger makes Dravid play away from the body, can't beat short cover
plays the off-drive to this outswinger, will get the single to mid-off
looks to flick this to leg, gets an inside edge on the pad, through to third man
angles this too far down the leg side
short of a length, around off, opens the face, gets the single to point
nicely flicked away off the pads for a single to deep square
another flick off the pads, another single to deep square leg
bowls the bouncer with men in the deep on the on side, he pulls this from in front of his face, all along the ground
on the length now, no room at all, defended from the crease
length ball, into the pads, pushed to mid-on
bouncer, shapes to pull, sways out in the end, border-line case for height, called one bouncer for the over
this doesn't quite come up and he has absolutely missile-pulled this, but straight to deep square for a single
after bowling some lovely outswingers last over, Broad goes back to bowling short! Rahane has absolutely launched it rows into the crowd behind deep square. That's a proper dismissal of a short ball
comes down the track, Broad bowls full, is pushed between cover and extra for a single
Dravid gives him the charge too, but makes too much room to end up missing this length ball outside off
starts with a normal quick delivery, on the length, on off, defended from the crease
short, not too wide, but he cuts this. Can't beat point
Rahane jumps out of the crease, Dernbach digs this one in short, beats Rahane's attempt at the cut
short of a length, just outside off, steered to third man for one
short again, Dravid has pulled this with massive force, but only gets a single to deep midwicket
the slower short ball, the legcutter, recovers well to work this to short fine leg for a quick single
driven to the left of Bopara who dives full length to deflect to a straight extra cover. One run saved
straying down the pads, worked away for a single to short fine
opens the stance a bit to make room and punch this through cover for a single
slower ball, but too short and straight, and this has been pulled to the right of deep square for a couple
slower ball, pitches on a length, middle and leg, pushed to long-off for a single

slower full toss, hit powerfully but not too far of Dernbach at deep square leg. A wayward loopy throw from Dernbach lets Dravid come back for second. He looked dead for 80% of that second run. The throw let him off. Was that the slower throw from Jade?
he is accurate with the ball, though. Short of a length, no room whatsoever, Rahane can't get it past point
anticipates another short-of-a-length delivery, and is waiting with the slog-pull. Nothing wrong with the delivery, but it's gone flying over midwicket
comes back with a good slower-ball offcutter outside off, Rahane is beaten on the late-cut
he has absolutely smashed a few here, but this is nurdled for four! The slower legcutter here, but too straight, and he has played this late, just to the left of the diving keeper
dabs this to third man for a single

Dravid is feeling the heat a bit here. Trying bit shots every ball. This time the bottom hand comes off as he looks to hit this over cover. Doesn't carry to the fielder in the deep, and he will get the single
and he is swept first ball, powerful shot too, but Dravid has found deep backward square again
straighter one outside off, pushed wide of point for a single
slightly short, Dravid rocks back and pulls this wide of midwicket for a couple
looks to seep this, is beaten, Swann appeals, but he has got some glove on this
cuts a length ball this time, gets just the single
top straight drive over Swann's head! Charges down the track and lofts it dead straight
quick, flat delivery, punched wide of extra cover, he comes back for the second
Dravid finds another fielder! This was a genuine long hop, and he has pulled this straight to deep midwicket. Dravid is really annoyed he has missed
fuller, into the pads, pushed into the leg side, all men on the on side are deep, and they can come back for two
straying into the pads, looks to flick, is beaten, and is hit on the pad
superb placement here, this is short of a length, he chips this on the up. It's like driving a long hop. But again dead straight. Gets four more
flicked away off the pads, but wide enough of long-on to let them come back for the second
short of a length, punches this offbreak into the leg side for a single
tossed outside off, Rahane covers the turn and then dabs it square for a single
another powerful shot from Dravid, this time a drive, and much better placement on it, wide of long-on
slightly short, Dravid rocks back to cut this to deep cover for one
punches this shortish delivery, but the straight extra cover keeps them in their respective creases
short, the straighter one, cuts it away, but gets just the single to deep cover
starts with a full toss on off, Rahane misses out, he pushes this to cover
lovely chip over extra cover... goes inside out to a length ball outside off after having given himself room. No power, all timing
and he goes wrong with the slower-ball legcutter, short and wide, cutting further away
the bouncer over the stumps, Rahane tries to go over short third man, but it bounces over his bat
goes for the yorker, ends up bowling the low full toss, but Rahane gets just the single to long-on
Dravid finds the fence! Finally a well-timed shot is placed just as well. Makes room, gets under the length ball, and drives it inside-out over extra cover. The strike-rate also crosses 100
slower short ball, pulled powerfully, wide of long-on, gets the second
angled across hi, dabbed behind square for a single

Superbly timed again, but he finds the fielder again. This time on the full. Dravid clears the front leg and looks to slog-sweep this full delivery, but doesn't get under it. Anderson takes the catch at midwicket
who flicks this offbreak wide of midwicket for a single
flat and full, flicked to long-on for one
shortish, Kohli punches this away wide of deep cover, they come back for two
flighted on middle and leg, Kohli flicks this to midwicket
lovely late-cut, almost from inside Kieswetter's gloves. In fact it hits the gloves on the way through, which means it doesn't travel for four

slower short ball, worked around the corner to bring up his maiden ODI fifty. A heart applause form the balcony, and shake of hands with Kohli. Sixty, forty, fifty (give or take) in his first three international innings
flicked in the air, but all men on the on side are deep
pushed past the diving Bopara for a single to long-on
slower short ball, too straight, pulled away to deep square for a single
drives this square with an open face, can't beat point
worked away off the pads, slightly wide of deep square, and they hare back for two
slogged away, along the ground, gets a single to long-on
some might call this a drop but Bell has done really well to charge in from long-on, dive in front, and get a hand to this ball swirling in the wind
makes room to dab this to short third for single
cramped up for room with this quick delivery, punches this to long-off for one
this is half mis-hit, half hung in the wind. Charges at Swann and hits this into the wind towards long-on, and finds Bell to perfection
regulation pace, low full toss, hit to midwicket
short of a length, plants the leg outside the line of the ball, and pulls it to deep square leg
slower legcutter, Rahane misses out on the flick, but gets a leg-bye
slower legcutter, cramps him up, Raina looks to steer it, Bresnan gets a bad turn at short third, Raina gets the second run too
gets the front leg out of the line and pulls this shortish delivery between deep square and deep midwicket
Aha. Right in Raina's range. Length ball, regulation pace, ripe meat for Raina, who throws the front leg out of the way to heave this over cow corner for six
flicked off the pads, gets a single to short fine
drifts in towards the pad, Raina is looking for the turn, and can only play it back to Swann
lovely shot, charges at Swann, makes room, gets inside the line, and goes over extra cover with a late wristy flick in the end
driven down the ground, a diving Swann gets a hand to it, but they get the single

Kohli won't be running too many for Rahane. Ajinkya looks for the straight loft that he has played so well so far, but gets too close to the pitch of the ball here, and doesn't get optimum elevation. Swann takes a smart, overhead return catch
flighted outside off, driven to long-off
full toss well down the leg side with the fine leg up!
slower legcutter, Dhoni delays the shot, clips this into the leg side for one
slower short ball, 112ks, it's short and wide with all off-side fielders up, but Raina is beaten by the slowness
The regulation pace! The regulation hit! Length ball. Clear the front leg. Heave it over cow corner

That hitting over the cow corner has got him a four to long-on! His hitting across the line has made sure the long-on is wider than usual, and this mis-hit goes to long-on, to the right of the man. Bell mistimes the dive too
one wide slower ball too many... the off-side field is all up, and Raina smartly waits for this before lofting this over cover
another slower ball, this one is closer to off, Raina tries the slog sweep, gets an inside edge through to the keeper. It reaches Kieswetter on the 55th bounce
and starts with a near-perfect yorker just outside off. Dot
this yorker goes wrong, and Dhoni flicks this low full toss wristily over midwicket
Helicopter. Crash-lands in Bell's lap. This is inches short of yorker, Dhoni tries the trademark whiplash flick, is too close to the pitch of it, ends up skying it to long-on

and what striking Raina is indulging in! This is some superb wrists and timing. This is a length ball outside off, he makes room, and then punches this with an open face, over deep point. Lovely hitting
a mis-hit for a change, as he inside-edges this into his ankle. However, he charges through for one
Tiwary gets a short ball into his ribs as the welcome to England. He manages to pull it to long leg for a single
slower short ball outside off, manages to hit to extra cover for one
Tiwary is surely jetlagged. He has run straight into Raina as they take a single off the pull. No damage done as they slow down just in time
tries the big pull, can't beat midwicket, gets just the single
slower length ball, Raina has nearly cleaned up Tiwary with this club. Bell runs to his right at wide long-on, and makes a sensational dive to keep them down to two
Missed out. That was a gift. Regulation pace. On a length. Into the pads. With the fine-leg up. Gets only a leg-bye
Dernbach is furious. Slower ball into the pads, Tiwary pulls this backward of square, and Stokes dives over it, conceding four when it should have been two

Stokes makes amends for that misfield. Raina gets too much under this length ball, trying to clear deep square, but the leading edge seems to have touched the moon and come back. Stokes at deep square keeps his eyes on it, and has to dive forward at last moment to complete the catch. What a cameo from Raina, though
full toss outside off, and he has agricultured it wide of deep midwicket for a couple
slower bouncer, he pulls it, mis-times it, but finds the gap wide of long leg for a couple

Bell has been absolutely sensational at long-on today! Tiwary clears the front leg and lofts this down the ground. Bell runs to his left making good ground, and then makes the dive in front to finish this ripper of a catch
Ashwin tries the scoop over fine leg, but this is wide outside off. The leading edge gets him a single
slower short ball outside off, Kumar is well early into the shot, they try to sneak in the bye, but Kieswetter runs Ashwin out

inn2.comm: Cook is away straight away. With a nudge of his legs. That's his multi-format shot
Kieswetter plays too early, closing the face and almost popping a leading edge back to the bowler
ping! When Kieswetter doesn't try to overhit he's an excellent timer through the off side. Praveen was a touch short and Kieswetter's back-foot punch raced away
straighter from Praveen and that's enough to block Kieswetter's scoring options
without room outside off, Kieswetter has to manufacture scoring options. Often without success, like here as he hares down, slogs, and misses
blocked carefully to point. Kieswetter is not much of a strike-rotater
Cook presents a Test-match straight backfoot defense to Vinay's fist ball
gifted the slightest rumour of width Cook slashes a drive to third man
inside edge works the treat here as two is picked off into the leg side
that's six and a half. Kieswetter skipped down, slogged, and this time smashed it a mile over cow corner into the stands. Didn't lose his shape on the shot
good return from Vinay, on a length and line. Kieswetter blocks carefully
Kieswetter hared down again looking for a repeat but this time Vinay followed him and he didn't have enough room to free his arms. Bottom edged bobbled away towards fine leg
touch too short from Praveen and that allows Kieswetter to slug it to deep midwicket
Praveen fullish here, straight too. Cook aims a heave towards leg but all seems a touch unnatural
neatly done from Cook here. Gets down on one-knee and flips it over his shoulder. Again didn't look perfectly comfortable but got it away effectively
ah that's more his area! Short and wide from Praveen and laced past point
seriously brisk start from Cook. Outscoring his big-hitting partner again. Clips this wide of mid-on
good over for England that! Kieswetter gave himself room outside leg, Praveen followed him but Kieswetter managed to flick it to the fine-leg boundary
shovelled pull shot isn't timed and it loops up before plopping into space. Probably a touch short from Vinay though
anything vaguely leg side that the batsman misses is always a wide. As Rob Bailey confirms
short ball zips through Kieswetter as he aimed a swish after skipping down the wicket
looks excellent when he plays this. Kieswetter gives himself a bit of room before easing his hands through the line with a perfectly-timed check drive over mid-off
straighter from Vinay and worked quietly to leg
the harder Cook swings, the closer the ball stays. Horrid sound of ball on toe-end of bat as Cook's pull shot dribbles to mid-on

again Cook swings inelegantly and it trickles off the toe-end. This time back to the bowler who flings it back past Cook. The batsman looks back with a sort of pained "but it was 4-0, mate" expression
starts with a filthy short ball shoved down the leg side that Kieswetter will be furious to have missed out on
Kieswetter jumps a good four feet outside leg but smashes his off-side smite to point
down the leg side again, perhaps Ashwin thinking Kieswetter would go there again. He didn't, it was wide
Ashwin offers a touch of air and Kieswetter cashes in. Backs away and heaves, with all his power, just about over the rope at long-on. Didn't get all of it, but got plenty
even better! That's a top shot. Kieswetter down the wicket, gives himself a touch of room and beautifully drives, powerfully into the same region
worked to leg quietly. Three dots, two sixes and a wide this over
straighter ball is top-edged but it loops towards a gap at fine leg
Munaf starts on a tidy length and line and is worked to midwicket
short and wide from Munaf is a gift for Cook. Cuts to deep cover easily
better length and no room outside off leaves Cook with nowhere to go. Batsman slugs across the line without connecting
enough width here for Cook to heave his arms at, banging it to long-on
Kieswetter is flying now. Didn't even mean to get four in this direction. Flashes at width and the outside edge  hurries to the third man boundary
after the boundary comes good running as Kieswetter flicks to square leg and scampers through
clumped into space in the off side for a couple
Vinay finds a perfect response to Jayesh! Kieswetter has given England a brilliant start but just pushed at the wrong line here and was struck flush on the knee-roll in front of off stump
Bell starts with Dravid-like orthodoxy
Bell is an awfully good player. Given enough of a chance up the order in ODI cricket he'll surely crack it. Lovely back-foot drive pierces the cover ring and skids away to the boundary
after all that elegance comes a hack as Bell misses out on a short ball
Bell again makes use of the Powerplay overs with textbook batting. Back-foot drive is perfectly timed and screams past point
Cook works a single off his pads to deep square, who slips as he fields. It's RP Singh too. Still, kept it to a single
RP Singh! Again! Good sliding stop here running round from deep point as Bell crisply swung a drive
driven down the ground quietly
slower ball is spotted by Cook. He steadied himself and then whacked it straight of midwicket and away for four
Kohli's bowling action is a lot like Chris Harris. This is down leg and mowed to midwicket
ooh, dropped! Kohli almost had a blinder here. Bell chipped back a leg cutter low to his right and Kohli got a good palm-full of it but couldn't cling on
Cook heaves this to the outfield and rejects Bell's offer of a second with a really desperate "nooo"
nicely done by Bell. Gets early into a reverse-sweep position and helps it through the fine leg/third man region
high-quality this. Wonderful batting. Gives himself a touch of room outside leg and then creams a drive through cover
straighter from Raina and whipped off the pads behind square
width outside off is chopped firmly to deep point
Cook manages to shove this to long-on
Cook picks a couple off his legs. I wonder how many times I've written that over the last 12 months
Kohli on the pads again and Cook brings up England's 100 by flicking to deep square. They've played very well, as far as short-form cricket goes
good line from the bowler draws respect from Bell
Bell would have been disappointed to only get one here as a leg-side delivery with clipped to short fine leg
forced neatly down the ground
good over from Kohli ends with Bell flicking a sweep to fine leg
speared down on a middle and leg line, Bell shuffling across to flick to fine leg. There's a man there, so just the one
Ashwin puts a little loop on this one, and finds some grip off the surface as Cook nudges to midwicket
the merest hint of width offered outside off, and Cook slaps to cover point

got him! Ashwin breaks through! A very ambitious drive from Bell picks out the one man close in on the off side - Virat Kohli - and the wicket gives India a glimmer. Bell had looked in fairly serene touch and hadn't had any trouble picking the gaps - until that shot
he's off the mark straight away, nudging an offspinner towards point
swept hard out to long leg

all sorts going on! Kohli, coming around the wicket, got one to keep very low and thud into Cook's pads, but it was immediately apparent that the ball was slipping down leg. A nervy Bopara had wandered out of his crease, and got back just in time as Kohli picked up and shied in his follow-through
Kohli lands one right in the blockhole, and Cook can only dig it out
hacked down the ground, Cook losing what little elegance he has at the crease as he looks to smite the cover off the ball
clipped off the pad, Bopara finding space for a single
Cook hammers the pull out to deep midwicket, but picks out the man on the boundary
silky shot! Really classy from Bopara, skipping out to meet the ball on the full and caressing it through the covers. Sahil looks about ready to swoon
Cook cuts, but doesn't really time the shot, and it's just a single
Bopara is very nearly run out again! Well, a better throw from Raina at mid-on and he was gone
how close was this? Ashwin went up to appeal straight away, but that looked to have pitched outside leg before scooting past Cook's sweeping bat and striking him on the pad
Bopara jumps out, and though Ashwin spots him coming and adjusts his length, he manages to find a single to square leg
creamed! Cook gets himself right to the pitch of a flighted offspinner and slams it over deep midwicket
slapped away behind point to end a very good over for England
crunched down the ground, just the one run
beaten by the slower one! Munaf found a great line with this slow legcutter, the ball buzzing past Bopara's hopeful poke outside off

fine response from the batsman! The quicker one from Munaf, but it's on a middling short length and just sits up to be hit, Bopara pinging the leg boundary well in front of square with a powerful pull
landing very full outside off, and squirted down to third man for one
shovelled into the covers for a single
another slower cutter from Munaf and Bopara, perhaps trying to hit the ball a little too hard, toe-ends it back to the bowler
swept in the air out to deep midwicket, Praveen rushes across to cut it off, slipping on the damp outfield but doing enough to keep them to two
innovation from Cook, stepping down into a reverse paddle to send the ball down to third man
fifty for Alistair Cook! Ashwin arrowed this one down full, straight and fast, but Cook jabbed down on the ball to send it into the vast open spaces on the leg side for a couple
was there an edge on this? Apparently not, as there's no excitement from anyone on the field. Play and a miss outside off then
dinked into the off side for one
Bopara is a touch squared up by the arm ball, pushing the ball in the air back towards the bowler, but it falls well short
Cook comes forward to slap a hard drive into the covers
hoicked down the ground, Cook didn't get all of it though and so the ball drops well short of long on
a very slow offcutter from Vinay, and Bopara picks it with ease, rocking back to pull to square leg
Cook clears his front leg as he attempts to attack the leg side boundary, but the ball doesn't come out of the middle and he has to scurry hard to make his ground at the non-striker's end
probing delivery from Vinay, but Bopara does enough to lay bat on ball and pick up a tip-and-run single
another slower one from Vinay, and Cook finds precious little timing as he sends the ball rolling towards long-off
heaved into the leg side! Short of a good length from Praveen, and Cook had more than enough time to pick his spot and play the shot
a whip-flick sends the ball rolling out to deep square
Bopara doesn't lay bat on this, but they take a single off the pad to bring up England's 150
Praveen comes round the wicket to Cook, aiming for the yorker but over-pitching slightly, the resultant full toss being driven out to long-on with minimum fuss
shot! Too short from Praveen, and aimed harmlessly down leg. Nevertheless, Ravi made the most of the offer, sending the ball sailing down to long leg with a meaty paddle-pull
flicked to short fine leg, where the ball is intercepted but not quickly enough to stop the single
punched down the ground, the batsman taking an easy single
Munaf sends down a gentle low full toss, and Cook eases him down the ground for one more
Bopara is a little over-enthusiastic on the cut, the ball rolling through cover point off the toe-end as he flashes wildly
fuller and straighter from Munaf, Bopara tapping back down the pitch
Bopara steps forward to drive to deep cover for a single
a whippy flick sends the ball rolling to midwicket, and they sprint through for one
turn and bounce for Ashwin! Cook is clueless as the ball dips and zips past his bat, but manages to keep his back leg grounded
more spin for Ashwin, but it means the ball ends up wide of off and is cut hard out to deep point
and now Cook sweeps to pick up another single

Ashwin strikes again, but is it too late for India? Bopara jumped out of his crease and set himself to mow down the ground, but couldn't quite get to the pitch, didn't pick the carrom ball, and ended up slicing across the ball to present a swirling chance to Kohli
Samit Patel is off the mark straight away, driving down the ground
whipped off the toes for a quick single into the leg side
nicely chipped by Cook, who scoops the ball to wide long off for a couple
ah, and this is not as nicely played, Cook losing his shape as he tries to thwack it down the ground
Munaf aims a slow offcutter right at middle stump, but Samit isn't troubled as he clips neatly to leg
Munaf finds the blockhole, Cook digging the ball out back to the bowler

well, you can't fault Praveen for effort. He charged round from long off as Cook shovelled one powerfully down the ground, diving and getting a hand to the ball inside the rope. Alas, the momentum of both fielder and ball meant the boundary couldn't be saved
Munaf well and truly gets the better of Cook with a slower ball that wasn't picked up, but the luck is entirely with England as a skied drive lands safely
Praveen spears down a low, dipping full toss which Cook turns into the leg side
driven on the up through cover
nicely full from Praveen, and the best Cook can do is dig this out for a single. This would be great bowling if England were chasing a few more runs, but the target is down to single figures now
squeezed out behind square on the off side for one more
another blockhole full toss, and this time it's pushed to square leg
driven down the ground, the batsmen push hard for the second
driven to cover, but Cook finds the fielder
this time he does find the gap, but there's a sweeper out to stop the shot
Samit jumps out of his crease but the ball slips beneath the bat and through to Dhoni
full, Samit slams a drive wide of mid-off but Kohli sprints across to keep them to one
full and straight, Cook works him off the pads for a single to deep midwicket
Samit tries to end the match with another big shot into the off side, but he can only bring England level as the cover sweeper cleans up
a full toss is whipped to leg, the fielder gets a hand to it but can't stop the single, and that's the game for England
